description.narrative: About 6 groups of male and boy champions have been strengthened in areas where core partners are advocating for equality in coffee and dairy value chains. As a result of trainings of leadership and champions for gender equality, awareness creation on equality is permeating the community. The organisation has trained women and youths on social rights in three core partners and as a result a women network in coffee has been formed in Kipkellion Union to champion women participation in leadership and economic affairs. A youth council has also been formed in Kipkellion Union to see how more youths can participate in coffee farming . The organisation is using transformatory gender approaches such as community conversations, art, theatre and open forums to sensitize on gender and question societal practices that hinder women and youth participation in coffee cooperatives. The organisation is using transformatory gender approaches such as community conversations, art, theatre and open forums to sensitize on gender and question societal practices that hinder women and youth participation in coffee cooperatives. The organisation held a women's confidence building training for two core partners (Gusii and Kipkelion ) targeting 30 potential upcoming women leaders to be able to look up into getting in to leadership positions at organisation and community levels. The organisation supported BAMSCOS in training 18 male champions on gender equality to support women empowerment initiatives and gender equality work within the organisation.

The aim of this project is to ensure that gender equality and women's human rights are respected in community development work and institutions. It aims at empowering women, engaging boys and men as agents of change to promote gender equality. It will support partner organizations implementing rural developemnt interventions in Kenya funded by We Effect to ensure that gender equality perspective and women empowerment components are strongly entrenched within the setcors. This project is expected to result to enhanced women's socio-economic empowerment as well as increased advocacy of gender equality issues affecting the rural development sector.

activity-date.narrative: Planned end date of the activity
Planned start date of the activity
